titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive collection, 1967-1970
American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Vishnu Jani and Issayas Tesfamariam

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-08-06T09:20-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Completely revised and reprocessed by Issayas Tesfamariam, typed up by archives students.
Added legacy container list information. Added description information for motion picture film.

did.unittitle: American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive collection

physdesc.extent: 8 manuscript boxes, 2 motion picture film reels, 2 phonorecords

did.abstract: Ephemeral publications of private governmental organizations, including the United States Agency for International Development, the government of the Republic of Biafra, and the government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria; press releases from the United States Department of State, American congressmen, and Markpress, the Biafran Overseas Press Division; clippings; periodical literature; and audio-visual materials relating to the Nigerian Civil War of 1967 to 1970. Collected by the St. Louis chapter of the American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1971.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive was an organization created to inform Americans of the conditions in Biafra during the Nigerian Civil War of 1967 to 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Ephemeral publications of private governmental organizations, including the United States Agency for International Development, the government of the Republic of Biafra, and the government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria; press releases from the United States Department of State, American congressmen, and Markpress, the Biafran Overseas Press Division; clippings; periodical literature; and audio-visual materials relating to the Nigerian Civil War of 1967 to 1970. Collected by the St. Louis chapter of the American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive.

controlaccess.corpname: American Committee to Keep Biafra Alive.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A statement about the plight of people in war zone and relief work of churches, national anthems of Nigeria and Biafra, sounds from a marketplace in Biafra, and poem "Mother Dark" by Francesca Yetunda Pereira.
